hints.content: To divide a shape in half, we divide the whole into **$2$ equal parts**.

This circle is divided into $3$ pieces:  

![A circle is divided into 3 unequal parts. 2 parts are almost half the circle. The third part is a very small section.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/27c324ac39dfee259f0d22a03caeb1050dd53b0d)

This circle is divided into $2$ pieces, but the pieces are not equal in size:  

![A circle has a line that does not pass through the center dividing it into 2 parts.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/03524415014c33097474902a2a107e7e05bb1ef3)

These circles are divided into halves:  

![Two circles have a line passing through the center dividing them into 2 equal parts.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/b1235d7389f6fe27509254aecf6bdfb5c9cfc1a4) ![](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/c1375863e8b4a58fbb00744a220c369701129726)

question.content:
**Which circles are divided into halves?**

[[â˜ƒ radio 1]]
